reviewText: Saw this on PBS and thoroughly enjoyed it, so I purchased the VHS tape.  They spend time in Oxford, England; Notre Dame Paris, France; Saint John the Divine, NYC, United States.  If you are fan of gargoyles and grotesques I recommend getting this documentary.

Mix in a little supernatural, a lot of guns (big guns!) and a lot of violence.  Forget plot, it is a vehicle to string together the shoot and bang.  The premise of this movies could have been good, but sorry it takes a story with some dialoge to carry it and this one doesn't have it.
This movie was so bad that I did not finish it. I have a pretty open mind when it comes to science fiction, but this movie just did not cut it.

Lightning Rod Studios, Milwaukee, WI. is producing some outstanding new films with green screen technology, and an amazingly talented group of creative minds.  This film, by Drew Maxwell, is not to be missed by those interested in fresh talent of the hightest caliber in the genre.  Watch out for Maxwell's future releases, as he continues to grow and develope a talented crew, exciting technology, and amazing special effects.
This movie was a finalist for best sci-fi feature at Shockerfest.  Great action.  Cool plot.  Decent acting.
